question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
The data in the stem and leaf plot shown are the long jump distances, in centimeters, that the girls team of Pseudo H.S. made at practice today. $(51|1$ represents $511$ centimeters$.)$ What is the sum of the median and mode of the data?

\begin{tabular}{l|lllll}
51& 1\\
52&\\
53& 2& 5\\
54& 0& 2& 2& 5\\
55& 0& 1& 3& 4& 7\\
56& 0& 2& 5\\
57& 0& 1\\
\end{tabular}
inference:
The median is the middle value of the data set when assorted in order from least to greatest. To find the median, first list the data in order from least to greatest:

511, 532, 535, 540, 542, 542, 545, 550, 551, 553, 554, 557, 560, 562, 565

The median is the middle value, which is 551.

The mode is the value that occurs most often in the data set. In this case, the value 542 occurs twice, while all other values occur only once. Therefore, the mode is 542.

The sum of the median and mode is 551 + 542 = 1093.

Final Answer: \boxed{1093}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: The median of the data is $55|1,$ or $551.$ The mode of the data is $54|2,$ or $542.$ Thus, the sum of the median and the mode is $551 + 542 = \boxed{1093}$ centimeters.
